website_summaries.verdict: Powerful for a hand mixer with a great-looking design.
pros: Comes with a snap on compartment that lets you store the attachments and cords with the mixer
cons: The low speed on this mixer is higher than expected

customer_reviews.title: but I bought it and it works great. Love the fact that the beaters (all 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reveiws and people said some things that made me hesitate, but I bought it and it works great. Love the fact that the beaters (all 5 of them - okay one is a whisk) are stainless steel. For getting the beater clicked on the box all you need to do is bring it in at an angle and it will go right into place for you. It does take a bit more energy to free for use but nothing that difficult. I am over 65 and I can do it, so i am sure you can too. Great beater would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mapsy

customer_reviews.title: Been using it for 2 years now
customer_reviews.text: Still working like it did when I got it! We probably use this mixer about twice a month, more in the colder months when we're baking more. So we're not high-use, but it's also not just sitting around collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani V.

customer_reviews.title: Only speed, fast and really fast
customer_reviews.text: This works well but I wish there was a slower speed than the speeds that are on there. It is pretty fast so there are some things that I can not make due to it being so fast! So I need to be careful on how much is in the bowl otherwise what I'm making would get everywhere. Can't complain about the price and it works and I still use it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Yes!  Pops on my Stand Mixer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a stand mixer (model 64650) with the same looking mixer as this but it burned out on very thick dough. I was hoping to find a replacement mixer that would attach to the stand but some reviews said this would not. WRONG! This popped right on my stand mixer and I am so excited that I don't have to trash it. Take note that this new mixer does not come with dough hooks, but does come with additional regular beaters that were not with the stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Julaine

customer_reviews.title: Real disappointment. 1 star only because it works
customer_reviews.text: Real disappointment. 1 star only because it works! No low speed - label says low & higher speed is definately high but have to resort to spoon in hand if slow & even lower medium speeds desired. Also ejecting beaters a challenge. They do release but need to press eject button hard which gets messy if beaters have mixture on them. Need to release beaters in sink.
customer_reviews.author: BPearl

customer_reviews.title: One of the main issues with this mixer is that the fan which cools the motor sucks air in the front vents
customer_reviews.text: This didn't get a lot of use and it's dead in three years. The gears stripped. One of the main issues with this mixer is that the fan which cools the motor sucks air in the front vents. When mixing anything that is powdery, flour, powdered sugar etc the fan sucks these particles into the body housing. A year or two into ownership I opened up the mixer and cleaned everything out with compressed air. At that time you could tell the gears appeared to be warn. Wear could possibly be excelerated due to the powdered food that was mixed and sucked in through the vent. Seemed like a nice mixer. Didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Skeeter-Bill

customer_reviews.title: This hand mixer is nice however, it is so darn heavy for what ...
customer_reviews.text: This hand mixer is nice however, it is so darn heavy for what it is. My hand starts to cramp up when I use it. I used to have a cheap Proctor hand mixer I bought at Walmart but the motor burnt out. It's an okay product, its just too heavy. Also I through out the additional storage piece. It was pretty useless to me. It didn't snap onto the hand mixer or anything. It actually just took up more space in my cabinets. I through out the plastic storage piece and put all the snap-in mixers in my drawer
customer_reviews.author: makeup lady

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I am in the process of doing a whole home renovation. I purchased a lot of products and first now started unpacking them. I used the Hamilton Beach hand mixer for the first time today and I saw a little cloud of smoke and it smelt like burning hair. I had to turn it off and stop using it. It's a piece of junk. I bought the Hamilton Beach can opener too. I hope it turns out to be a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Dita

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer, love the snap-on storage case and extra accessories
customer_reviews.text: Nice mixer, I love the snap-on storage case (that was actually my main motivation for buying this one) and the fact that it comes with multiple accessories. My only gripe is that it doesn't seem to have as much power as other mixers I've used, and I find myself using the High setting where on other mixers I'd be using Medium. But it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but power speed button is glitchy
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a great design, love the different kinds of attachments, the position of the eject button is smart, and the motor is powerful. The power switch is glitchy on mine. Don't know if it's a design flaw, but when I push the power button up it sometimes turns off instead of going faster. It's like there are dead zones in between the different speeds. It's odd but the appliance starts right back up with you reposition the power button. Considering how inexpensive it was, I'm not inclined to be terribly picky, but if little stuff like that drives you batty, you might want to consider a different item.
customer_reviews.author: Lindley Karstens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful piece is affordable and even comes with its own case to hold the attachments et the unit itself. This means there's no scattered pieces. It's very secure. Aside from this, this piece has several speeds et a burst button. Comes with several helpful and versatile attachments. Although it was delivered with less attachments than advertised, upon contacting the seller yielded a much agreeable solution to the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Pursell

customer_reviews.title: Worked but looks used
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it five stars but I noticed the packaging inside the box kind of sucked or lacked any enthusiasm also had scratches on the side now they were small scratches but I kind of feel like a bought it at a yard sale not through Amazon I will not return it because it's just a couple scratches and I'm lazy. but a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ela Chicharron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the price. I tried it on a heavy, thick cake mix and the mixer worked great. I also put the the beaters in the dish washer and they came out clean and looking as good as new. I just wish the other 2 types of whisks and beaters came in matching sets. I only received one standard matching set of beaters. The other beater and whisk came as single items. The description didn't really specify that (Versatile attachment set includes traditional beaters, wire beaters and whisk), and I wish it did.
customer_reviews.author: gkspk

customer_reviews.title: excellent hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: excellent hand mixer, variable speeds allow you to get the job done. this is the second one i have owned. at Christmas time i do a tremendous amount of baking and the previous held up for years so i can only hope that this one does as well.
customer_reviews.author: Janice in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Classic is a Great Name for this Hamilton Beach 6-Speed Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this new mixer. The one we had was a wedding gift from almost 48 years ago and the beaters would not stay in the head in the old one. This mixer has a great variety of different mixing speeds, looks great and is at least twice as powerful as our old one. My wife probably has the old one stored somewhere out of sentimentality but she uses and loves this new mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J. Nix

customer_reviews.title: This mixer is HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since I've shopped for a hand mixer. My old one finally died so I purchased this one. It was much larger and heavier than I expected. It has a big storage bin that the attachments fit into and the mixer snaps onto. When the mixer is snapped onto the top of the bin, It's so tall that it barely fits on the shelf in my cabinet. It works fine but if you're mixing something for a while (like whipping cream), you'll probably get tired due to it's weight. I'll probably just get rid of the storage bin and store the attachments in a drawer. I'm disappointed that I can't find a smaller, lighter one.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sue

customer_reviews.title: It blows downwards
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, who can design a product like this? It blows air downwards so if you use it to mix flour, you'll have flour all over your workspace.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful mixer !!!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is perfect and I love all the attachments it comes with. It is also so handy that everything stores in the container attached to the bottom. Then I never have to worry about looking for the pieces when I want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Imjen69

customer_reviews.title: It is lightweight and has been wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the kitchen aid stand up mixer but never really used it. I just had to have it because everyone else did haha. I sold it and got this and now I have counter space back and at least I'll get my money worth out of it! It is lightweight and has been wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: hkelly

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Lasted 1.5 years before breakup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 1/2014. This hand mixer and I could never agree. The storage container was donated within a few weeks because the blender was top heavy and toppled over all the time. Regardless of speed of the mixer, the bowl size/shape or how little powder ingredients (flour, cocoa powder etc) I used, the fan in the front would suck up the powder creating plumes around it, and leaving gunk inside the mixer's motor. I broke up with this mixer at the end of 2015.
customer_reviews.author: amynicole902

customer_reviews.title: Does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: Does a pretty good job. Definitely have to scrape the sides of the bowl; and I wish it had a little more power. I find myself accidentally pushing the boost button with my finger while trying to manipulate the bowl around to get all the sides clean; and then when I release the boost button, I realize I needed that extra power anyway. Good deal for the money, but if you can afford to spend more for a higher-end unit, I would.
customer_reviews.author: kelkat

customer_reviews.title: It's hard to find a great mixer these days!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer rocks! I mean, if small home appliances could be Rock Stars, this one would be the Aerosmith of the appliance world! Big sturdy mixer, easy to use controls, three sets of beaters, and all of it tucks together in a handy carrying base that stores handily in a cupboard. I have made several batches of baked goods, a nice batch of meringue, and some frosting with this thing so far and the results have been excellent. This hand mixer is a hundred times better than the terrible Kitchenaid hand mixer that it replaced. Like a super group delivering a stellar performance, this mixer will get you a standing ovation.
customer_reviews.author: An American consumer

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good
customer_reviews.text: Do you know you can burn out the motor on one of these things if you keep trying to use on really thick cookie doughs? Well, I just learned that lesson after doing the above to my MIL's mixer. So search high and lo I did and this one seems to fit the bill of being sturdy and hopefully a motor that can take a cookie dough in a fight any day - time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Franco de Salvo

customer_reviews.title: That may sound like a good thing
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is VERY powerful!!!! That may sound like a good thing, but the slowest speed, which is supposed to be slow enough for blending dry ingredients, is soooooo fast that everything flies out of the bowl all over the place. It's even too fast to mix a cake mix! The fast speed is unusable. I would opt for returning it, but the shipping costs eat up nearly the entire return. So I am left with keeping it. One nice thing I do like is that the snap on storage case is very nice. Keeps everything neat and tidy..... Just wish the mixer were as neat and tidy!
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the mixing ability of this hand mixer. However, the plastic part that holds the beaters in place broke after only a few uses. It was used for cake mixes and mashed potatoes, so nothing too dense that would have caused this problem. Very disappointed in quality. Was unable to return to Amazon due to time limit on returns. Called Hamilton Beach and they are shipping a replacement mixer for the cost of s/h. Hope this one lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly fine for light mixing jobs, extra attachments are a bonus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily because it comes with extra attachments and a storage bin. Having used this a few dozen times, the mixer has proven to be perfectly able to handle lighter jobs like creaming butter, and mixing cake and muffin batters. I hand mix/knead my cookie and bread doughs, so I can't comment on its performance there. The extra attachments are really handy, too. I tend to use the open wire beaters because things don't get stuck in the beaters (unlike the traditional ones, where a lot of thicker things can get stuck against the center bar). Meringues and heavy cream were a lot easier to whip up with the included wire whisk, as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Yu

customer_reviews.title: So powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a nearly-fried older hand-held mixer with this one. I was amazed at the power behind this little mixer! I love that it came with extra beaters in a variety of different shapes, and has the bin that clips on to contain everything. This can easily mix very thick cookie dough, creams butter & sugar with ease and is much quieter than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Jill G.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, solid performance
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this little mixer! I don't use it often, but it has worked well for cheesecake batter, mashed potatoes and cookie dough. I love the stainless steel look (it matches my kitchen decor) and the plastic storage unit for the beaters. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that it's a bit tricky to finagle the beaters and cord into the storage unit and click it into the locked position.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Old Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these because my mother had one and I thought it was awesome. Hers was an older molder but it was a very sturdy hand mixer. I love the fact that it has different mixer attachments for all different things, most hand mixers just don't come with that. And you can't beat the fact that you can just put everything up into a container and keep it moving! I love that, no more lost pieces, attachments, etc. it's great, and it doesn't look cheap. Great price, great mixer, great looks, great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Indispensible kitchen tool.
customer_reviews.text: Well built, inexpensive hand mixer with a variety of beaters. Six speeds are available for different mixes, densities and consistencies. The beaters are easy to attach, detach and clean. A convennient storage case for the two pairs of beaters and a whisk is included. The power unit is relatively light and easy to manage. A minor drawback is that is is unstable when set up on its end on the counter. Other reviewers have described it in details. I shall simply add that I like it and, to date, have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: SInohey

customer_reviews.title: hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton Beach 62650 6-Speed Classic Hand Mixer, Silver - Love this hand mixer- the handle/light weight and 6-speed motor with eject button for different beaters included. This hand mixer is powerful enough for many different batters including bread like dough. It has and boost button for extra thick batters. Worked perfectly and I am extremely happy with all the capabilities and extra included attachments. I highly recommend for anyone who is looking for a full purpose powerful hand mixer. Would purchase again from seller- Shipment was fast especially with Amazon prime.
customer_reviews.author: elh

customer_reviews.title: The hand mixer has a speed control that is very ...
customer_reviews.text: The hand mixer has a speed control that is very difficult to work. After instructions from HB to work it back and forth 20 times, it was still too tight. I arranged for UPS to pick it up for return to Amazon and printed the instructions and they would not take it. I’m stuck with it and I’ll never order a HB product again.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta roe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand mixer, I don't know how I've lived so long without it! I make lots of cookies and baked goods whenever I'm stressed (I'm in college; hence, I'm stressed a lot) and this makes baking so much easier! I used to mix my dough by hand and give my arms a workout while baking, but this hand mixer saves me time and energy! It's also very easy to clean (pop it in the dishwasher or hand wash it) it's not a tedious job to do! I also love how it has a bowl rest and is compact for easy storage! I've been an avid Hamilton Beach product user and this mixer did not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: colormeviolet

customer_reviews.title: Too fast and bottom storage does not attach to mixer base
customer_reviews.text: I really think it's lowest speed is too fast. It has 6 speeds and I doubt that I would use anything above 3. The lowest speed is way too fast for most of the low speed mixing I need to do. Also the bottom piece that holds the attachments does not actually attach to the mixer. You can rest the mixer on top of it, but it would have been nice, and the pictures suggest, that the bottom attach to the mixer so you can carry everything around by the mixer handle. This is not true. Good mixer for the price I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Simple
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use mixer; exactly what you would expect. The different mixing speeds are great and all good powerful speeds. Comes with different attachments, which are easy to use and switch out. I love the snap on base to store them all in, so I am never left with one blade and ripping my kitchen apart looking for the other. It is easy to store, and just all around a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I had like this hand mixer. I have a stand mixer that I used for my heavy mixing, but there are many times I just need to whip up some cream or egg whites and the big stand mixer doesn't do a great job. I need a little one to do the small jobs. This one is great. I do like the self contained mixer attachments and it is a little heartier than the basic model. Some of my other ones started so sound like they were run on squirrel power. This one seems strong and has worked great so far. I would consider using it for heavier jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Momof4

customer_reviews.title: Very well made mixer, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is a replacement for my old hand held. It works well and feels heavy, not cheap plastic. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peanut_22

customer_reviews.title: Best hand mixer I’ve had
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and powerful hand mixer. I’m downsizing and letting go of my big stand mixer. I’ve been worried about having just a small one, but I think this will do just fine for almost everything.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: A good gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to someone.I have this be cause I have had one for a few yrs.and it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Barb

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years later and its still holding up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer 2 years ago. It's nice, easy to clean, and now in 2019 it still works just fine! Plus it is good quality for a small mixer! I'd recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jess Ade

customer_reviews.title: good features
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is very powerful which is good and bad. There is no low speed so dry ingredients splatter easily. It is powerful enough to mix dense batter very well. Sturdy so it won't tip over. I also tried the Oster 2500 Inspire 240-Watt 5-Speed Hand Mixer which was much less powerful (motor sounded like it was straining and had a faint burning smell) and was poorly designed so it wouldn't stand up on the counter.) Convenient storage of beaters and other attachments in a unique design. It requires extra storage space when clear bottom is snapped onto upper portion, but no more searching for beaters. Clever idea. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: not bad but not for me
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and LOUD. Even low speed seems super high. It also nicked up my glass bowls which I was always able to use a hand held in before. I would rather do small stuff by hand or bigger things in my stand mixer then deal with this. I am not saying it is horrible, it is just not for me. The nice feature is that is has a bin that clips to the bottom to store the beaters and cord end all together
customer_reviews.author: C. Funk

customer_reviews.title: Has a storage container
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, lightweight. This is the 2nd time I purchased this item. The 1st one lasted 5 years
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia woodley

customer_reviews.title: Suits the purpose
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to be using this mixer every day to be whipping up complex culinary works of art. I will use it occasionally to make mashed potatoes or infrequent cake mixes. For me, this is a perfectly usable and inexpensive addition to my vacation home kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Corsi

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Storage apparatus is very difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: The blender worked well and didn't throw dry ingredients around like my past blenders. However, the casing to store all the attachments and cords is nearly impossible to get latched. The cord juts out the side and I have to use all my strength to get it to clasp. I almost think I'll probably put the attachments in a drawer and not even try the storage option. It's really hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: tara_nicole

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Great value, and a great carrying case. It comes with some additional attachments, but I haven't used any of them yet. Got this because I was getting tired of hand mixing cake/cookie/brownie mixes and wanted some that would be easy to pack away in the cabinet when not in use. I cannot stress enough, the little plastic case on the bottom is GREAT since you can just throw all of the accessories and the cord in there when storing it. Also, the cord rotates so you can stand the mixer up if you have dirty attachments still on there.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hand Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this was an excellent purchase. I would have given it 5 stars if it had just one really low speed, but overall a good addition for my kitchen. Plenty of room for your hand to hold and move it as necessary. Stainless looks great with all of my stainless steel appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: You could not ask for a better mixer! My twenty year old hand mixer finally bit the dust so I had to find a replacement.. I do have kitchen aide stand mixer but do not like to use it that often. Too much of a hassle putting together and cleaning up. This little guy comes with a storage bin for all the mixing accessories and the cord! Fits great under the counter and you never have to search for hours in the utensil drawrer for your mixers...
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: BEST Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST hand mixer! I replaced my newish Kitchenaid fancy mixer with this because the Kitchenaid just did not have the power it should. This mixer is unbelievable and comes with so many attachments (that I'll probably never use). Can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rodriquez

customer_reviews.title: Great top speed
customer_reviews.text: Love the top speed on this mixer. Low speed could be slower. I have a kitchen aid that has good slow speed but not good top speed, so this is a perfect mate. I LOVE the container that keeps all pieces and cord together. Very easy storage!
customer_reviews.author: Connor D.

customer_reviews.title: Slow down!
customer_reviews.text: The lowest speed on this mixer seems too fast. When mixing batter in a large bowl, and starting off on the lowest speed, I ended up getting a lot of "freckles"! Also the "burst" button can accidentally be hit when holding the mixer, only contributing to the problem of maintaining a slow speed. The mixer is well built, comes with enough attachments, and the storage base is good. Cord is long enough to allow ample movement.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 99

customer_reviews.title: Clever Storage
customer_reviews.text: Am so happy that I purchased this hand mixer! It whips up deliciously with all the different paddles and I love, love, love how everything stores in its own case and that you can store and carry it by the handle! Lightweight and easy use, a clever idea to keep everything together and stored neatly. Am thinking of purchasing another for a shower gift!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but box had been opened
customer_reviews.text: The mixer is fine - it's basic. The box had obviously been opened and mixer cord wasn't wrapped and mixer itself had a couple of small scratches on it. Lately, several items from Amazon have arrived having been opened before & I'm just tired of returning items. This mixer works fine and has a set of old style beaters which I like (also has new style). But I'm getting more & more concerned about Amazon purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Be4me

customer_reviews.title: A "Handy" Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase! I have not complaints about it. Besides matching my kitchen appliances, the mixer handles well, the lowest speed isn't too fast (like some others), the attachments are easy to insert, and the case it comes in is so cool! I really like the case because I don't have to worry about saving the box to store it or attaching it to a large bowl and it's base. I have minimal space. It simply slides back into the cabinet for another day.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlight

customer_reviews.title: this mixer looks just like an iron
customer_reviews.text: Without the beaters in, this mixer looks just like an iron. Sadly, it also mixes like an iron. I know that lots of other reviews say that it has no low speed but I must have gotten a real lemon because even at the highest speed, frosting doesn't even come off the beaters. I'm going to keep it as a backup but I'll be buying a different mixer for my day-to-day use.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen Forman

customer_reviews.title: Good Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I've had mixer for about two weeks. I bake a lot so I have used it a lot. It's a little heavier than my last one, but not a big deal. The plastic cover that holds the attachments is a little difficult to snap onto the mixer so I just will either toss it or, as I'm doing now, just lay the mixer on top of it rather than get frustrated trying to snap it in place. But the speed is excellent, faster than my last one. And the power is really there, so I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: GavinsMom

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer! It works well and feels sturdy. It has a strange beater storage container that is supposed to attach to the mixer but it is difficult to attach and makes it an awkward size to store. I just leave it off.
customer_reviews.author: srbrownell

customer_reviews.title: beware - speed setting #1 is warp speed 5, no impulse power
customer_reviews.text: Wife had an old pink hand mixer. Upgraded her to this. However, she still uses the pink one for when she doesn't want to beat things that fast <snicker>. No for reals, this mixer is like a total powerhouse, but if you are looking for a hand mixer that beats slowly, this one can't do it. Make it so number one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Storage Doesn't Snap On
customer_reviews.text: The storage case is useless and does NOT snap on whatsoever. There are grooves in the plastic but nothing on the mixer to attach it to. It just takes up storage space when I can throw the beaters in the a drawer. Seems cheaply made, but seeing as it's a $25 mixer, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: osciamella

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is very powerful - I love it! The case is nice for the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Lefler

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I like this mixer. I love the storage container it comes with. The mixer is a little bulkier than I'm used too.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Harper

customer_reviews.title: Good item for the price
customer_reviews.text: well made item that seems blend things well and has proven to be durable.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase has been a long time coming. I really wanted a quality mixer that wouldn't fall apart in two seconds. This mixer looks sweet and is really durable. Comes with different beaters for different jobs. All of it contained together. A bit bulky but doable. Has worked beautifully for all that I have used it for thus far! Spending the extra few bucks makes a big difference. This one seems like it will last awhile. I have burned through so many cheaper models that this was just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: jessi

customer_reviews.title: The mixer does the mixing job just fine, but I find myself having to hold the ...
customer_reviews.text: The mixer does the mixing job just fine, but I find myself having to hold the mixer toward the rear of the handle to effectively use it. I've been using hand mixers for years, so I guess that the balance on this one is just a little different from what I'm used to. Also, the snap-on storage container is really nice though it takes a LOT of effort to get mine to snap on completely (I won't have to worry about it not fitting securely over time!)
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Works well! Read other reviews for details
customer_reviews.text: Working great for pancakes and cakes. Fairly simple to use. I don't think I am going to add anything new to these 100s of reviews except to say, yes, it works well
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area Cooler

customer_reviews.title: I bought it based on the good reviews. I use it mostly for making chiffon ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it based on the good reviews. I use it mostly for making chiffon cakes and this one doesn't work that well when beating the egg whites, maybe because of the shape of the beater of the highest speed isn't high enough. It's also a bit heavy. If I knew this earlier I'd choose a different mixer, a more expensive one maybe. But for some other purposes or for someone else, this could still be an ideal purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Grace M.

customer_reviews.title: Still working after five years
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer. Still using it. Quite strong in my mind. Gets things mixed well. I wish it could be less bulky but I am not going to complain. I think the plastic parts are flimsy but so far they are fine after five years.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: I do not bake very often so when I realized that I probably do not have a good product, I had passed the deadline to return ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this mixer!! The vent is in the front and every time a little flour blows in, it smokes!. I do not bake very often so when I realized that I probably do not have a good product, I had passed the deadline to return it and consequently I am stuck with a smoking mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Attachments
customer_reviews.text: I hand-washed the beater attachments and left them to air dry. They sat for a couple of days in the drainer and they were already starting to rust. The power of the unit is fine but what can you do with rusted beaters?
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Burned up after four light uses, very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible mixer. I have used it four times for easy jobs (creaming softened butter and sugar, whipping cream cheese, etc) and it started smelling like it was going to catch on fire. I have never even used it for cookies or batter of any kind. It didn't work correctly now. The mixer is also very heavy. May not bother some, but if you are used to a lighter mixer this will be a big adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: qfamily

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd Hamilton Beach appliance I have purchased and been very disappointed with. I should have known when there were ...
customer_reviews.text: I am SO done with Hamilton Beach. This is the 3rd Hamilton Beach appliance I have purchased and been very disappointed with. I should have known when there were so many returned mixers of this model that it was a problem. When I received this item the beater was broken. How do you break a beater?!
customer_reviews.author: aurora2

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles like crazy. We could hear the screw
customer_reviews.text: Came with a screw loose where the beaters fit inside. Wobbles like crazy. We could hear the screw, so my husband opened it up and put the screw where it belonged. In a few uses, the screw came loose again. Since we opened it, we couldn't return it. Very disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Tallman

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit in the container well, and not a very low speed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Henson

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sleek
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky snapping on however very compact!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for whipping cream, but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: This item is great. I love the attachments and the container that connects to the blender for storage is great. Having the whisk attachment I have been able to make fresh whipped cream which has been wonderful. Great product with a lot of power
customer_reviews.author: Christalu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the one I had. My beaters finally broke and it costs the same to replace the mixer than to order new beaters from the company!!
customer_reviews.author: JNET

customer_reviews.title: real nice but only 1 round wisk
customer_reviews.text: i like using it in double wisk mode but it comes with 5 attatchments and the odd number means theres only 1 round wisk
customer_reviews.author: Maria V.

customer_reviews.title: Had this before ane bought again!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same mixer about 5+ years ago and it finally broke after being dropped enough times. I loved it so much that i purchased the same one again. Its awesome that it has all the attachments and a nice storage compartment to hold them all.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Varchetto

customer_reviews.title: Big and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I'd been using my mom's old hand mixer for the last twenty years, and I really didn't think a new one would offer much improvement. I was wrong. This thing is a workhorse. It's slightly bulky, but between its thoughtful design and tremendous power, it's worth a little girth. The attachments are terrific. Two traditional mixing blades, two with round edges (for mixing without hacking), and one attachable whisk.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Berry

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: functional and sleek. needed one for my kitchen really badly as i love to bake, this one was a good price but it dosent click/hook on the the container/ carrying case. the container is supposed to hold all of the mixer attachments and the mixer is supposed to be able to attach to the container like a lid, but it dose not. still the mixer is great quality and has lost of power. i use it all the time and every time im thankful to have it
customer_reviews.author: Maegan Quaife

customer_reviews.title: like cheaper discount store versions
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power and won't burn out making more thicker mixes or using it longer, like cheaper discount store versions. Worth the money to avoid buying 3 cheap ones in 3 years. I would rather pay a little more for something that will last versus going cheap and replacing often.
customer_reviews.author: T.B.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: It's been years since I bought a mixer. When I got this today I was very happy. My old one is tiny and only had one pair of blades. I like this one because it is a nice size and not to heavy. Another reason I bought this one is because I like the fact that it has different attachments and sits on a case that stores them. I don't have to go digging threw a drawer looking for them.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good job doing the work
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. It was a little on the heavy side, actually a lot on the heavy side but it worked so well I couldn't complain. It didn't get clogged up nearly as much as the old one I had and it did the job. I wished it was lighter but I imagine for the price that was as good as it gets. On the other hand if I didn't have fibromyalgia maybe it wouldn't seem heavy at all so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn C.

customer_reviews.title: I Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of baking, this mixer is great for heavy mixing, very very well made and I love the container it holds the attachments and the mixer snaps in nice, easy too store, I absolutely recommend this 100%,
customer_reviews.author: Tracey De.

customer_reviews.title: which is a great idea. However the mixer does not snap in ...
customer_reviews.text: it works as expected, however the mixer is supposed to fit on top of a plastic bin that holds the mixing tools, which is a great idea. However the mixer does not snap in so it's not secure and just falls off all the time. I find I have to store them separately. Not ideal when one doesn't have a lot of space. Also the lowest speed is still quite high.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, comes with handy snap-on bin for parts and cord, I didn't even know! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: KyleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sold on Hamilton Beach!
customer_reviews.text: My mother really loved Hamilton Beach and I have found that I do also! I purchased this to replace a mixer for my daughter. I have an earlier version of this and have really loved it. Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: TxGrandma

customer_reviews.title: Works great and has a lot of useful attachments
customer_reviews.text: Works great and has a lot of useful attachments. It also has a snap on clear container in which you can store all the attachments. Very appreciative of the storage since it keeps my kitchen more organized.
customer_reviews.author: Raemey

customer_reviews.title: Mixes Every Time
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a while now. Works great. Lots of power and lots of power controls. Its a little bigger than expected and stores a little harder, but worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Randy McDonald

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a more expensive hand mixer a couple years ago. It stopped working after about a year. I needed to replace it and looked at multiple mixers here on Amazon. Based on reviews and price, I went with this Hamilton Beach mixer. I have used it several times since receiving it and I am very pleased with it. Its lightweight, mixes easily and comes with two different sets of beaters for different needs. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisified
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the space for a mixer with a stand, but I wanted a powerful mixer and this one definitely is that !! I love it, it is stronger than others I've had, but I can definitely get used to that. I can use a larger bowl to keep it from splattering. It will make the holiday baking so much easier, even if the dough is very thick.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Every body is happy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the mother in law! She thinks it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: bob layman

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: No low speed! Not great for blending foods with smaller items mixed in, like chocolate chips
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make cheesecake as the cream cheese requires whipping, As you can imagine, cream cheese is thick so it takes a lot of strength to whip. This little guy made short work of it and is my new best friend! Much cheaper than a stand mixer and takes up less space! I also love the carrying piece that stores all the extra pieces and cord.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Ari

customer_reviews.title: Really great hand mixer, Hamilton Beach 62650 6-speed.
customer_reviews.text: Really great hand mixer. Only thing is you need a bowl with high sides, even on low speed, so the 'stuff' stays in the bowl. This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: walker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. It is very powerful and can mix everything. It is a little bit heavy, but does the job very well done. I like the small storing area of the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Faisal

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer because I lost one of the beaters to my other mixer and couldn't find it anywhere. With this mixer, I'll never have to worry about that because it comes with a place to keep the beaters with the mixer, and comes with different beater options. This mixer also seems much more powerful than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave & Amy Astle

customer_reviews.title: Good brand. Good mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Reliable brand. Reliable hand-mixer. I like that the mixer snaps onto the plastic container that contains all the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: t in saipan

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product as I have aged a bit my hands get tired easily so this has helped a lot made a lemon cheesecake a few weeks ago for guests and it was a hit.
customer_reviews.author: April

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Classic 6-Speed Electric Hand Mixer with Snap-On Storage Case, Whisk, Traditional and Wire Beaters, Brushed Stainless (62650A)
product_meta.description: Style Name:Model 62650AHamilton Beach hand mixers are powerful and are designed with a focus on versatility and ergonomics. Features convenient snap-on storage cases, which keep attachments together so you don't have to search for them each time you need to mix. Hamilton Beach hand mixers have handles that are designed for control and comfort, and the unique Bowl Rest feature allows the mixer to sit on the edge of the bowl to eliminate messy drips. A special QuickBurst button provides a quick boost of power and can be used for tough tasks at any speed. Features Include: Snap-on storage case 290 Watts peak power makes mixing easy Convenient mixing features including QuickBurst button and Bowl RestVersatile attachment set includes traditional beaters, wire beaters and whiskBrushed stainless steel housing
feature_bullets: Snap-on storage case for instant storage - no more lost beaters
290 Watts peak power makes mixing easy
Convenient mixing features including QuickBurst button and Bowl Rest
Versatile attachment set includes traditional beaters, wire beaters and whisk

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,465 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
